critique: The document is a formal executive order regarding the Anglo-American Committee of Inquiry. It expresses a desire to aid the committee in its task of examining conditions in Palestine and the situation of Jewish people in Europe. The language is formal and legalistic. There is a sense of purpose and resolve, but no strong emotions are explicitly conveyed. Therefore, the initial scores are relatively low across all emotions. Revised scores reflect the formal and neutral tone of the document, with slight adjustments to reflect the underlying purpose.
